data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3171343,"name":"","username":"SkyRay","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/ea5d25/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-23T13:10:33.373Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eI’m not particularly sure whether any other team has experienced these issues, but we ran into the problem that the rotational part of our MK4I swerve modules keeps squeaking when it turns. This is from a constant 2-month period of using our modules for practice, so we assumed that it was just from us damaging them from continuous wear, but this was especially loud and a little concerning for us at the time. We chose to ignore it as we could not identify the problem at the time.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eHowever, while packing these modules as backups for competition, we realized that the screws (\u003cstrong\u003ethe 10-32 1/4 inch button\u003c/strong\u003e)that held in the 4-inch bearing actually came from all four modules. This allowed for the bearing to slide down just a bit while driving and caused the belt rotating the module to mesh with other parts, causing this squeaking sound. Thankfully, we ordered extra screws in time for our first competition, but before our practice match, we found that 10 of the 20 screws became loose on our competition robot. We used blue loctite 242 and only used our competition robot for about an hour before having to leave for our event.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eHave any other teams experienced this problem? If so, what did you guys do to solve it?\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2023-03-23T13:10:33.373Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":85,"reads":157,"readers_count":156,"score":456.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":431441,"topic_slug":"sds-mk4i-swerve-modules-squeaking-screws-becoming-loose","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53619,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"woop wah"},"post_url":"/t/sds-mk4i-swerve-modules-squeaking-screws-becoming-loose/431441/1","custom_user_title":"woop wah","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3171348,"name":"Cody Gagnon","username":"cody29158","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cody29158/{size}/198530_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-23T13:16:19.226Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eI’d recommend both \u003ca href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Loctite-1329467-Medium-Strength-Threadlockers/dp/B009I2UC3Q/ref=sr_1_2?crid=KH84AIRNFWAO\u0026amp;keywords=loctite+243\u0026amp;qid=1679577329\u0026amp;sprefix=loctite+243%2Caps%2C103\u0026amp;sr=8-2\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003eloctite 243\u003c/a\u003e rather than 242 (it has muich better oil resistance) as well as cleaning the shipping oil off your screws before assembly using either alcohol or acetone. We did both these with all our modules and have not had any issues with these screws coming
